newsitem.title: UK: LME copper sluggish but finds support in evening.
newsitem.headline: LME copper sluggish but finds support in evening.

text.p: London Metal Exchange copper prices slumped back to around the $2,350 a tonne level shortly after the end of afternoon kerb trading.
But there appeared to be sufficient buy orders on any dip to around this level to underpin prices during a rather thin evening inter-office session, traders said.
Traders did not see Tuesday's moves, around $30 from high to low, as particularly significant as the market was still well within its recent wide overall trading range.
At 1900 GMT three months delivery copper was bid back up slightly to be quoted at $2,357/$2,360 a tonne compared with $2,359/$2,360 at the 1700 GMT close on the exchange floor.
